official-title.#text:
To require servicers to establish a deed-for-lease program under which eligible mortgagors may
			 remain in their homes as renters.

enter into a deed in lieu of foreclosure agreement;

text.#text:
The Program requirement under paragraph (1) shall not apply to a small servicer, as such term is
			 defined by the

Servicers shall provide each eligible mortgagor with information about the Program and how to apply
			 to participate in the Program.
A lease entered into by an eligible mortgagor under the Program shall—

carry a monthly rent amount equal to the fair market rent for such property, as determined by an
			 independent private appraiser hired by and paid by the servicer; and
contain all typical lease provisions for similar rental property.
An eligible mortgagor may apply for the Program at any time.
If there is a foreclosure sale pending with respect to the property—

the eligible mortgagor may only apply for the Program before the date that is 7 days before the
			 date of such foreclosure sale; and

once the eligible mortgagor applies for the Program, the foreclosure sale shall be halted until
			 after the eligible mortgagor’s Program application has been evaluated.

The eligible mortgagor is subject to a financial hardship that makes the eligible mortgagor unable
			 to continue making timely payments on the eligible mortgage loan.

The eligible mortgagor is eligible to pay the monthly rent amount described under subsection (c)(1)
			 and such amount is no more than 31 percent of the eligible mortgagor’s
			 monthly income.

The eligible mortgagor currently lives in the property and intends to continue doing so during the
			 1-year lease term.

text.#text:
If an eligible mortgagor applies for a Program with respect to a single family property subject to
			 a junior lien—

if the servicer of the Program is also the holder of the junior lien, the servicer shall release
			 the junior lien and, subject to the other requirements of this section,
			 the eligible mortgagor shall be eligible to participate in the Program;
			 and

if the servicer of the Program is not the holder of the junior lien, the servicer shall contact
			 such junior lien holder and request that the holder release the lien,
			 and—

if the holder releases the lien, then, subject to the other requirements of this section, the
			 eligible mortgagor shall be eligible to participate in the Program; and

if the holder does not release the lien, then the eligible mortgagor shall not be eligible to
			 participate in the Program.

The servicer shall evaluate the eligible mortgagor’s application within 30 days of receiving such
			 application and shall accept an eligible mortgagor into the Program if the
			 eligible mortgagor has provided the proof described under subsection
			 (d)(3)(A).

Promptly after making a determination under paragraph (1), the servicer shall notify the eligible
			 mortgagor of such determination in writing and, if the servicer determines
			 that the eligible mortgagor may not be accepted into the Program, the
			 servicer shall specifically explain in writing why the eligible mortgage
			 was not accepted.
Any subsequent owner of the property being leased pursuant to the Program shall—

maintain the Program and abide by the terms of the Program to the same extent as the servicer of
			 the eligible mortgage; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 property, that they will abide by the terms of the Program.
